DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Early Discontinue Reason Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response used to determine whether treatment of disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation was stopped early.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._At or near the beginning of a period of time or course of events._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: At or near the beginning of a period of time or course of events.:Discontinued; stopped permanently or temporarily.

Concepts.definition: At or near the beginning of a period of time or course of events.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Intervention of Procedure Discontinuation Reason Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).: A problem that occurs when treatment affects healthy tissues or organs. Some common side effects of cancer treatment are fatigue, pain, nausea, vomiting, decreased blood cell counts, hair loss, and mouth sores.: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

The term was used in various ways in the past, to describe unintended effects of medical intervention, usually negative (unfavourable), but also positive (favourable) ones. It is recommended that this term no longer be used and particularly should not be regarded as synonymous with adverse event or adverse reaction.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.: Failure of a patient to follow medical advice, take medication as directed, or adhere to a prescribed course of treatment.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.
Failure of a patient to follow medical advice, take medication as directed, or adhere to a prescribed course of treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A schedule is an ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.

Concepts.definition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.: A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Alternative Therapeutic Procedure For Other Reason

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Alternative Therapeutic Procedure For Other Reason
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Available in place of something else.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.: The reason of something.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: Available in place of something else.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The reason of something.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A primary malignant neoplasm in a patient who has been already diagnosed with a primary malignant neoplasm in another anatomic site.

Concepts.definition: A primary malignant neoplasm in a patient who has been already diagnosed with a primary malignant neoplasm in another anatomic site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Added; extra; further.: Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.
Added; extra; further.
Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.
